name: dexedrine
properties: {"dose": "Light: 5-10mg Common: 10-20mg Strong: 20-30mg.", "avoid": "Other stimulants.", "onset": "20-60 minutes.", "aliases": ["dextroamphetamine", "dexamfetamine"], "summary": "A highly abusable stimulant. It is rarely prescribed in the US to treat ADHD, and is very similar in effects to Adderall, as its main ingredient is 75% of what adderall is.", "duration": "3-6 hours.", "categories": ["stimulant", "habit-forming", "common"], "after-effects": "2-24 hours.", "half_life_hours": 11, "is_user_created": 0}
sources: {"_general": ["pregnancy category C according to the FDA - http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2007/017078s042lbl.pdf"]}
tolerance_model: {"notes": "Dexedrine (dextroamphetamine) is a potent stimulant and is the baseline reference for stimulant tolerance.", "neuro_buckets": {"stimulant": {"weight": 1, "tolerance_type": "stimulant"}}, "half_life_hours": 12, "active_threshold": 0.05, "standard_unit_mg": 10, "potency_multiplier": 1, "duration_multiplier": 1.2, "tolerance_gain_rate": 0.25, "tolerance_decay_days": 5}

name: methylphenidate
formatted_effects: ["Increased alertness", "Euphoria", "Increased motivation", "Reduced appetite", "Flushing of the face", "Increased body temperature", "Tachycardia (Increased heart rate) Paranoia", "Insomnia"]
properties: {"dose": "Oral Light: 20-40mg  Common: 40-60mg  Strong: 60-80mg  Heavy: 80-100mg+ | Insufflated Light: 5-15mg  Common: 15-40mg  Strong: 40-60mg  Heavy: 60-75mg+", "onset": "Oral-IR: 30-120 minutes | Oral-XR: 30-120 minutes | Insufflated-XR: 5-10 minutes | Insufflated-IR: 5-10 minutes", "aliases": ["mph", "ritalin", "concerta", "biphentin"], "effects": "Increased alertness, Euphoria, Increased motivation, Reduced appetite, Flushing of the face, Increased body temperature, Tachycardia (Increased heart rate) Paranoia, Insomnia.", "marquis": "Moderate orange yellow ", "summary": "A psychostimulant commonly used in the treatment of ADHD, narcolepsy and obesity, particularly in the EU instead of Adderall. Methylphenidate is also a 5HT1A receptor agonist. Sometimes prescribed off-label to help the withdrawals from cocaine and other stimulants.", "duration": "Oral-IR: 3-6 hours. | Oral-XR: 8-12 hours. | Insufflated: 2-4 hours. | Note: XR formulations become IR before they can be insufflated, so duration should be mostly the same.", "categories": ["stimulant", "habit-forming", "common"], "after-effects": "1-24 hours.", "half_life_hours": 2.4, "is_user_created": 0}

tolerance_model: {"notes": "Methylphenidate is a dopamine/norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor with somewhat lower per-mg stimulant potency and shorter duration than dexedrine. Builds moderate stimulant tolerance with relatively fast recovery.", "neuro_buckets": {"stimulant": {"weight": 1, "tolerance_type": "stimulant"}}, "half_life_hours": 3, "active_threshold": 0.05, "standard_unit_mg": 20, "potency_multiplier": 0.4, "duration_multiplier": 0.8, "tolerance_gain_rate": 0.3, "tolerance_decay_days": 2}
